# ğŸŒ Objective

This analysis focuses on loading, exploring, cleaning, and saving the **World Happiness Report 2024** dataset using **R**.

**Dataset Source**: [Kaggle - World Happiness Report 2024](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/ajaypalsinghlo/world-happiness-report-2024)

---

# ğŸ“¦ Load Required Library

```{r setup, message=FALSE}
library(readr)
```

---

# ğŸ“ Step 1: Load the Dataset

```{r load-data}
# Read the dataset (ensure the CSV file is in your working directory)
data <- read_csv("world-happiness-report-2024.csv")
```

---

# ğŸ‘€ Step 2: Display the First 5 Rows

```{r head-data}
head(data, 5)
```

---

# ğŸ“Š Step 3: Summary Statistics

```{r summary-data}
summary(data)
```

---

# â“ Step 4: Identify Missing Values

```{r missing-values}
colSums(is.na(data))
```

---

# ğŸ§¹ Step 5: Clean and Save the Dataset

```{r clean-and-save}
# Remove rows with missing values (if any)
cleaned_data <- na.omit(data)

# Save the cleaned dataset
write_csv(cleaned_data, "cleaned_happiness.csv")
```

---

# ğŸ’¾ Output

The cleaned dataset has been saved as: `cleaned_happiness.csv` in your working directory.
